You're the human equivalent of a Terms of Service agreement because everyone ignores you and scrolls right past.
If you were a CSS property, you'd be display: none.
Your conversation skills have the throughput of a 56k modem in a thunderstorm.
You're honestly the reason some people prefer talking to chatbots.
If your life was a repository, it would have zero stars and a hundred open issues.
You have all the charisma of a 403 Forbidden error page.
You're what happens when a machine learning model is trained exclusively on junk mail.
If you were a mobile app, you'd be the one that requires fifteen permissions just to do nothing.
Your personality is like a CAPTCHA since it's frustrating, repetitive, and nobody enjoys dealing with it.
You're the human equivalent of a low battery notification when you're at two percent.
If you were a font, you'd be Comic Sans because you're unprofessional and nobody takes you seriously.
Your social life is like a dead pixel; once you notice it, it's just annoying.
You're the kind of person who uses Password123 and still manages to forget it.
If you were a keyboard, you'd be the Scroll Lock key because you're completely useless.
Your brain is like a browser with too many toolbars installed since it's cluttered and slow.
You're the human equivalent of a YouTube ad that nobody can skip.
If you were a data structure, you'd be a black hole where everything goes in but nothing useful comes out.
Your wit is like a trial version that expires right when things actually get interesting.
You're what happens when someone forgets to add a return statement to a function.
If your personality was a cloud service, it would have zero percent uptime.
You're the kind of person who types https://www.google.com/search?q=google.com into the Google search bar.
Your potential is like a crypto wallet where someone lost the private key.
If you were a PDF, you'd be the kind that you can't even highlight or search.
You're the human equivalent of a LinkedIn thought leader post.
Your vibe is like a laptop fan spinning at max speed while the computer does absolutely nothing.
If you were a video game, you'd be a pay-to-win where you still find a way to lose.
You have the depth of a Read More button that just leads to a page of more ads.
You're basically what would happen if a bug was promoted to a feature.
If you were a smartphone, you'd be the one with a proprietary charger that nobody actually has.
Your life is like a Slack channel where every single person has you muted.
You're the human equivalent of an 'Are you still watching?' prompt when nobody is in the room.
If you were a programming language, you'd be WhiteSpace because you're invisible and pointless.
Your memory is like a RAM stick with a loose connection.
You're the kind of person who replies 'K' after receiving a three-paragraph message.
If you were an OS, you'd be the one that forces a restart right in the middle of a presentation.
Your impact on the world is like a No-op instruction because you occupy space but do nothing.
You're the human equivalent of a 144p video playing on a 4K monitor.
If you were a browser, you'd be the one that asks to be the default every five minutes.
Your creativity is like a 0kb file because it's technically there but contains nothing.
You're what happens when someone hard deletes the documentation and walks away.
